raw_text:
Irish duo could block Man Utd bid
 
 Irishmen JP McManus and John Magnier, who own a 29% stake in Manchester United, will reportedly reject any formal £800m offer for the club.
 
 The Sunday Times and The Sunday Telegraph say they will oppose any formal £800m takeover bid from US tycoon Malcom Glazer. Mr Glazer got permission to look at the club's accounts last week. Irish billionaires Mr McManus and Mr Magnier are said to believe that an £800m bid undervalues club prospects.
 
 Mr Magnier and Mr McManus, who hold their stake through their Cubic Expression investment vehicle have the power to block a bid. Mr Glazer's financial backers, including JP Morgan, the US investment bank have said they won't back a bid unless it receives backing from the owners of at least 75% of the club's shares. However, there has been much speculation that the Irish duo simply do not think the price offered - 300p a share - is high enough. Mr Glazer has been stalking the premier league football club since 2003.
 
 Mr Magnier and Mr McManus issued a statement late on Friday saying that they remained "long-term investors" in Man Utd. The Sunday Telegraph says the board of Manchester United also considered a management buyout at just over 300p but did not go ahead with it.
llama3.2:1b: Irish duo JP McManus and John Magnier, who own 29% of Manchester United, will reject any formal £800m bid to take control of the club due to concerns it undervalues their prospects. They also believe the current offer is too low.
llama3.2:3b: Irish duo JP McManus and John Magnier will reportedly reject any formal £800m offer for Manchester United, believing the price undervalues the club's prospects.
gemma2:2b: Irish billionaires JP McManus and John Magnier are reportedly rejecting an £800m takeover bid for Manchester United from Malcolm Glazer. They believe the offer undervalues the club's prospects, and have the power to block the bid. Glazer requires backing from 75% of shareholders to proceed, but his financial backers have stated they will not back him without this.
qwen2.5:0.5b:
Irish billionaire JP McManus and John Magnier, who own stakes worth 29% in Manchester United, have reportedly rejected any formal £800m takeover bid from US tycoon Malcom Glazer. The Irish duo believe an offer undervalues club prospects and do not think the price offered is high enough for them to accept a formal bid.
The article highlights the situation where JP McManus and John Magnier, who hold stakes of 29% in Manchester United, are reportedly rejecting any formal £800m takeover bid from US tycoon Malcom Glazer. They have long-term investors in the club at stake, while Glazer's financial backers insist on a more cautious approach to the deal.
The article suggests that McManus and Magnier do not think the price offered by Glazer is sufficient, as they were long-term investors in Manchester United. They issued a statement saying they remain "long-term investors" in the club, but the board of Manchester United considered a management buyout at 300p per share.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Irish owners JP McManus and John Magnier reportedly reject any formal £800m bid for Manchester United, citing low valuation concerns. The duo own 29% of the club through Cubic Expression investment vehicle. Glazer's financial backers won't support a takeover unless at least 75% of shares are backed by Irish investors. Glazer has been seeking a deal since 2003.
qwen2.5:3b: Irishmen JP McManus and John Magnier own 29% stake in Manchester United and are reportedly set to reject a £800m takeover bid from US tycoon Malcolm Glazer, despite Glazer having permission to view club accounts. The Irish investors believe the offer undervalues the club's potential, while Glazer requires at least 75% share backing for his bid. Despite speculation about the valuation not being high enough, McManus and Magnier have stated they remain long-term investors in Man Utd.
